Articles.Content:
So i recently came across the playstation trailer for KSP, and it was pretty amazing. Mostly because i noticed the introduction of new music that perfectly suited the KSP theme. i know from 5 years of experience from this game that music while playing brings a whole new level of magic to the spaceflight experience. 

So now I'm left with two questions:

1. where can i download that new music? XD

2. Are there any plans that the developers of KSP would produce a full soundtrack to the game, instead of the royalty free music we have now? In addition, are there any players that are also interested in seeing this become a reality?

 

Trailer (listen to the music!): 

 

Edited November 24, 2016 by justspace103

The main theme is a custom composition, the rest of the in game tunes are Kevin MacLeod cc music.

Since this song contains phrases if the main theme, I'd conclude the music is original.  Hence, not likely available.

42 minutes ago, justspace103 said:

In addition, are there any players that are also interested in seeing this become a reality?

I am interested in seeing this become a reality. I feel that complete soundtrack would make the game much more amazing, especially in a space game,where soundtrack can really have a major influence on the experience.

I agree. I think KSP really needs its own soundtrack. 

I feel like games that don't have people talking such as KSP need a good and varied sound track or else the player just ends up getting bored/annoyed with the limited music.

I think the current KSP sound tracks are not bad but there are just too few of them so we end up hearing the same thing over and over.

Good music can really add an extra layer or two into the enjoyably.
Personally, while I agree KSP should get own soundtrack, IMO developers should simply open the music track API more, and "jukebox" mods with awesome custom playlists would arrive in abundance.
